comments:
This course introduces students to the breadth of bioengineering through weekly
guest lectures and a series of small projects and reports that allow students to explore
different facets of bioengineering.
Overall, students found this course informative and a nice introduction to
bioengineering. However, some believed that it was too easy and spent too much time
talking about different subdivisions within bioengineering and not enough time
discussing the overall field. Many felt that topics covered in this course were generally
broad and did not go into too much detail. Many students wish the course spent more
time delving into each topic, rather than skimming over each topic briefly.
Students had no complaints about Professor Margulies, but wished that there were
fewer guest lectures throughout the semester. Each guest lecturer would highlight his or
her area of engineering, which “was an excellent way to showcase the types of research
being done at Penn” that the students could potentially get involved with.
Some students commented that the course should be “made into a real, one credit
class with real work and learning,” proposing a change from the current half credit
course. Many of the assignments were seen as busy work, but overall the class was
“easy” and “excellent.”
